adjective.definition: Ready, eager, or prepared to do something.
adjective.example: He was quite willing to compromise.

noun.definition: The act of one who wills or chooses.
noun.example: The willing of the goal implies the willing of the means.

verb.definition: Intend, desire, or wish (something) to happen.
verb.example: He willed himself to keep going.

verb.definition: Bequeath something to someone by the terms of a will.
verb.example: She willed her estate to the charity.

usage_examples: I am willing to help you.
